It's eery, tuneless, but awfully authentic... and it fits intensity of the moment: Mackelway and Katie, coupling ma their eyes locked. She's breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time we've seen him shirtless since his injury in t furnace room. A FAT BANDAGE covers a quarter of his chest Dried blood can be seen beneath it. There's an intensity in his eyes. The chanting, the candl Katie's body, his wound... they've conspired to bring an intensity into his eyes. It's dark, primal. And he's been expressing it for an hour without relent... which is why Katie gasps one last gasp, then rolls to the of the bed, exhausted. She reaches for that boom-box, lowers the volume. The cha dies down into silence. She catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't anymore. Mackelway eyes her, then reaches past her, and turns the VOLUME on that boom-box back UP. The chanting fills the r again. And just like that, he has pulled her back onto him, urge That primal side hasn't been sated yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway stands at the mirror, changing the dressing on wound across his chest. He unwraps the gauze over that fa bandage soaked through with blood. He pulls the bandage off, giving us a better look at the gash. Dried blood, torn skin, bruising. Looks like hell. Mackelway eyes it calmly. He slugs down some beer from a nearby bottle, then cleans wound with some Hydrogen Peroxide... as Katie appears in doorway. She eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't sleep? He shrugs, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Navajo. A song for dead warriors. I never played it for anybody before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just had a feeling you'd like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. The way you stare when you think nobody's looking. She shrugs. Silence hovers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4:30 a.m. Rain pounds the window and roof, a real storm o there. The boom box is still. The candles are down to the nubs. Katie continues to sleep. Mackelway too. Then his eyes SNAP OPEN. Something just hit him, something huge. One of those 4:30 the-morning ideas that has to be expressed. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway stands outside Room 217 at a Mariott. He's just knocked on the door. Fran opens it, in a robe. Very confused. He looks manic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get a read on this guy. Two minutes ago, she was sound asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he sending us all this shit? I've got 800 pins in that map, 800 missing people. What's he telling us? She gets it now: he's on a combination of painkillers and of sleep. Or maybe she can sense where he's been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire) He kills a travelling salesman, then a school-teacher. Then Starkey? It doesn't connect. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a mess... MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I'm clear. I just didn't think this could wait. Fran, this guy is trying to point us at something. Starkey's part of it. But the other two don't connect. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you drive here? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine! I just need somebody to think this through with me! He wanted to meet me. It's like he was interviewing me somehow. What is that? Then he kills Starkey. So what was he doing with Speck and Fulcher? FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come in? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. You come out. Get dressed. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out where? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Somewhere. We're right on the edge of this thing. She studies him. A long beat. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to bed. You're welcome to the couch if you want. I think you could do with some sleep. He sags a bit. She reaches for his hand. FRAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Mack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that, there is contact. Their hands. It surpris them both. He appreciates it, but now's not the time. So he smiles thinly, turns, and goes. She watches him vanish around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been to this house before. Suburbia. Mackelway sits in his car, at the curb, studying the plac Rain falls in sheets, wind blows. And there he is, all al six in the morning, staring at a house. That idea - the thought that snapped his eyes open - it's still working on him. Beside him is the DRAWING that was in Speck's car: The rendering of a steamer-trunk, lined with plastic, containing body parts in plastic bags... Mackelway seems fixated on it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand knocks on the front door. Jan Speck opens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoping for good news:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Mackelway? Mackelway stands in the doorway, rain falling behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all business)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Speck. Just had a few more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway sits at the WINDOW, looking over the backyard. Nothing special out here: some trees, a swing, a storm-ce door. But he's staring at it, intently. We're not sure why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Jan re-enters, purse over her shoulder, umbre in hand. She grabs his cup of coffee and saucer from the coffee table. JAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I don't have more time, Agent Mackelway. It's my PTA Day. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. I should've called. She smiles tightly: "I have to go now" and heads for the kitchen. Once she's there, Mackelway turns to the BACK DO and UNLOCKS IT, eyeing that storm-cellar outside... She leaves the cup in the sink. He enters the kitchen. JAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I was of some help. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were. Thanks. JAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of mine said I'll feel like this one month for every year we were together. Sort of a grieving rule-of- thumb. Have you ever heard that? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) No. Sorry. She half-smiles. He turns to the door. Turns back. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. There was one other thing: Did he keep any kind of chemicals around the house? Acids, that sort of thing? JAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Why? He shrugs, dismissing it: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Trace elements we found on his trunk. Any interest in chemistry? Maybe as a hobby? Jan pauses for a moment, as if recovering a faint memory. Then she shakes it off. He lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, thank you. And thanks for the coffee. Next time I'll call first, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway sits in his car. Through his windshield we see as she backs out of the driveway. She pulls past us, giving Mackelway as friendly a wave as grieving widow can give. He waves back. Then she's gone, disappearing around a corner. Mackelway pauses a beat, checking his rear-view mirror to sure. Then he gets out of his car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway sneaks around the side of the house, pulling on lever to unlatch the side-gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He emerges into the tiny backyard, making a bee-line for storm cellar door. He knows he shouldn't be doing this. It's beyond risky. B here he is, without a warrant. There's no lock on the cellar door. He reaches for it. Th stops himself. Just noticed something: A NEIGHBOR-LADY, visible just over Speck's backyard fence looking right at him through her bedroom window. Fuck it. He enters the storm cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven steps, leading to a dusty cement floor. Mackelway l around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing him are the things a meticulous man would store in of disaster: Cans of food, sternos, sleeping mats, drums potable water. And long FOOT-LOCKERS. Two of them. That's where Mackelwa eyes go, instantly. He hurries to them. Throws one open. Nothing but sheets and blankets inside. paws through it... finding nothing else. He throws the other trunk open. Inside? Pillows. Fuck. He slams it shut, looks to those cans of food, stacked on shelves. He approaches the shelves, jostling cans from th rows, making more noise than he ought to. But he finds nothing behind them... except more cans. He approaches those two huge drums of water, lugs them aside Behind them is a tall CUPBOARD, locked. He pulls at the cupboard door, hard. It splinters. Inside, a rifle and some boxes of ammo... same as you'd f in every other storm-cellar in Texas. He pauses: Am I crazy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He emerges from the storm-cellar, confused. Shuts the sto cellar door. Then he turns. Something else just caught his eye: Above Speck's bedroom window is another window, a tiny on attic... He heads for that UNLOCKED BACK DOOR, and enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries toward the stairs, reaches them... then spots something through the Entry Hall window: On the street outside, pulling up to the curb... is a POL CAR. Sirens off. That Neighbor-Lady must've placed the ca And here's Mackelway, without a warrant. Shit. Two ABILENE COPS get out, approaching the house. Mackelwa climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he stays quiet, he might just pull this off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny hallway, with four doors. Up ahead, dangling from ceiling, is a tiny rope which promises a set of hidden fo out stairs... and an attic. Mackelway tugs on the rope. The fold-out stairs drop down of the ceiling. Then he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's inside! He's inside! Went in through the back! ...which means he has mere seconds before this all blows hell. So he climbs up those fold-out stairs. The two ABILENE COPS now circle the house, entering throu the back-porch door, just as Mackelway did. He pulls up the folding stairs. Maybe the guys'll do a ha assed search and then leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway looks around: lots of dusty junk around here - clothes, mementoes. ...and one more trunk. A steamer-trunk. Huge. And locked. Looks just like the one in that DRAWING rendered by O'Rya Mackelway races for it. Takes out his gun, uses the butt- to bust the lock off. Throws it open. ...as we hear the sound of those fold-out steps, being tu down from the second-floor hallway. And:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze, Asshole! The COP is just ten feet away, most of him still conceale those steps - gun trained right on us. But Mackelway seems utterly untroubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Fellas. FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet. Mackelway drops his gun, kicks it toward the cop, who doe quite know what to make of that. Also confusing him is the odd smile playing its way acros Mackelway's face. But we understand it now: The inside of that steamer-trunk is filled with BODY PART bagged, stacked, and sealed in Ziplocs... Powdered LIME is sprinkled on them. Mackelway stares, at once satisfied and sickened. COP #1 be heard, approaching across the attic floor. His gun is drawn... ...until he too sees what's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a Grammar-School CLASS PICTURE: of Barney Fulcher and 2nd Graders, sitting on a mantle. We are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That picture sits beside other photos, awards, plaques - celebrating Fulcher's career in Colorado education. We turn away from that mantle, blowing through this modes Living Room, finding an open door - leading down to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the steps we go, until we hear the HUM of an old FRE We turn toward the sound. The freezer is open. A team of FORENSICS GUYS study it. Inside this freezer, frozen into a block of ice... are si female HANDS. No arms, no heads. Just six slender hands, with a wedding band on the ring finger. Mackelway stands in the back of this basement, taking it in. He looks to Charlton, who is expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102a EXT. FULCHER'S HOUSE - DUSK Close on Mackelway as he returns to his Yukon satisfied. pleased with himself. Out of nowhere, a firm hand grasps right shoulder stopping him. Mackelway turns abruptly, finding himself sandwiched betw his Yukon and Charlton, who is now in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me Cowboy. You have any idea the kind of favors I had to pull with the Abilene cops to cover your ass?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not allowing him to talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking and ENTERING the Speck house without a shred of evidence and NO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not going down without a fight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sample I took from Speck's bumper... It's crystallized sulfuric acid mixed with oil of Clove, the clove neutralizes the odor of the acid. Charlton shakes his head, he is not getting through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was SPECK not his killer who was hiding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever ask yourself why a big shot agent from Dallas gets sent down to the Wichita Falls Field Office? I'll give you TWO WORDS... Hell I'll even write it down for ya. Charlton leans in to emphasize his point. He pulls out a and pencil from his breast pocket and writes what he says Mackelway's chest as support. It's humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "EVIDENTIARY PROCEDURE." Don't talk about it. Learn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those words just hang there, haunting Mackelway. Charlton tears off the sheet with those two words and stuffs them Mackelway's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out you were right about this guy. You were right about both of them. But that doesn't change the fact that you went about your business like a rookie. Got it? Charlton turns, the buzz of a street lamp breaks the sile throwing a circle of light around the Yukon. Mackelway wa as Charlton puts on his headlights and drives away. A sudden gust of wind tears that piece of paper out of Mackelway's hand, he stares at it, as it disappears into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything yet known about the murders of Speck, Fulcher, Starkey fills the wall space in here: We see O'Ryan's MAP: All those yellow pins... and the one one, (Greenville, Tx.) Also, that DRAWING: of the ghastly Ziploc bags inside a steamer trunk. Damn thing seems pres now. Agents mill about, awaiting a conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing by)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job, Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. A few OTHER AGENTS also pat him on the back. Fran's proud him too - we can see it. In fact everyone in here seems t giving Mackelway his due. It all feels good. Charlton enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated please. The agents find seats around the table. Charlton takes hi place at the head of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the assembled:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We've got a serial killer of serial killers. Fran scribbles something on a piece of paper: "What a gen Slides it over. Mackelway conceals the note, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still grand-standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a transient with a history of mental illness. He also happens to think he's a former agent of this Bureau. And he is pursuing something that he calls "Suspect Zero." Anybody got anything intelligent to say? Nobody's volunteering.   There's just silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (familiar refrain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway exits the office, heading for his Yukon. Then he stops... because Katie is waiting out here, leani against her Toyota Camry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fondly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin', huh? Guy with a wife and kids keepin' bodies in his attic? He nods... but what is she doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just... Wondered if you could do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway waits... as Katie hands over a manila envelope. Mackelway opens it. Inside, a photo of a heartbreakingly-sweet 22 year-old gi named KAREN SUMPTER, with an attached sheet listing her vitals: height, weight, age, etc. Another face. Another disappearance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Karen Sumpter. We were friends. (almost reluctantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappeared last year. Nobody knows where. She was a little wild, but not like that. Her sadness is obvious. Mackelway nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I know you're gonna be in on the autopsies - of the girls they found over at Speck's. Figured you might see if one of 'em was... Her voice trails off. This is hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is, I'd like to be the one to notify her folks. Out families've been friends for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... 'Night. Mackelway puts the envelope under his arm. She starts up Camry. The sky rumbles. He eyes her. For some reason, she hasn't pulled away yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles. Shadows on the wall...and Mackelway and Katie, a again, with the sounds of that eery Navajo CHANTING comin from the boom-box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway is studying her, staring into her eyes, her breathing. She's beginning to climax now... and those eye wider. We MOVE INTO THEM, and: We are abruptly SLAMMED, again, INTO ANOTHER SET OF THOSE DISJOINTED IMAGES from that unidentified place:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wet wind in a blur of gray. The sound of our own heavy breathing. A voice rising above the wind, pleading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is utterly lost now. And that CHANTING seems to have gotten louder somehow. IMAGES FLICK at us now: culled from that BOOK on TRIBAL R AND TRANCE, found at the halfway house: a TRIBESMAN with rolling back in his head, foaming at the mouth. Mackelway tries to shake it off, tries to keep his focus Katie. He buries his head into her neck, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall wheat, wet wind. Then a MUZZLE FLASH, and a body slu to the ground. And suddenly we are in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan, at a desk. He has just "remote viewed" these imag somehow. And they've left him rattled. It's time to get out of this room. Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stolen, non-descript CHEVY pulls out of a motel room pa lot, on to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan is behind the wheel, driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio is BLASTING - anything to shake those images ou his head. Driving, unsettled... which may be why he doesn notice that there's a SIREN wailing behind him. He looks in the rear-view. A TEXAS STATE TROOPER is on hi tail. Shit. O'Ryan tightens, pulling over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TROOPER approaches, noting the condition of the vehic He stands before O'Ryan's window. O'Ryan's face reveals n evidence at all of anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See your license, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course. Is there a problem? O'Ryan reaches into his back pocket, produces an I.D. Han over. Trooper eyes it. According to this i.d., we are now stari "James Garvey" from Littleton, Colorado. But the Trooper doesn't seem too convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See your registration, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. O'Ryan opens up the glove compartment, starts searching through it. But it's a stall, that's obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind stepping out of the car, please? O'Ryan pauses. There is no way in hell he's going to let himself get deterred by a State Trooper. But he gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper eyes him with caution. O'Ryan holds his hands in of his chest, keeping them visible to the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, I am carrying something that could be construed as a weapon. I'd like to hand it over, voluntarily, so you won't think I'm trying to conceal anything. Would that be all right? TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of weapon, Sir? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hunting knife, right here on my hip. Trooper notes the shape of that large, sheathed KNIFE - t one O'Ryan butchered Starkey with - visible beneath O'Rya shirt. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on my way to the woods. My gear's in the trunk. (Trooper doubts it) Would you like me to hand it to you? I don't know what the procedure is for something like this. TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the weapon off your hip, place it on the ground, and kick it toward me. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy to. O'Ryan takes the knife off his hip. The size of it gets s attention from the Trooper. TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly were you planning on hunting, Sir? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fifty-foot shark. No reply. O'Ryan drops the menacing knife to the ground a kicks it toward the Trooper. Trooper, slowly, kneels down to get it - never taking his off O'Ryan. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know, I used to be in law enforcement too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kneeling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmmm. FBI. 'Course this was some years ago. Trooper grabs the knife, straightens. Examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psy Ops. Classified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had anything to drink tonight, Sir? Under medication of any kind? An 18-WHEEL TRUCK rumbles by, distracting O'Ryan... rende him immobile for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. Just found myself wondering what was inside that truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm going to ask you to hand me the keys to your vehicle, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. O'Ryan opens the car door. We steal a look INSIDE. ...he's got a GUN under the front seat. In a flash, that gun is in his hands and pointing right a forehead of that Trooper. Trooper knows he's been had. And he knows that he's about die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway approaches, carrying a greasy bag: another Frit and a soda. Fumbles with his keys... Then he notices something, waiting on his doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a thick FILE, roughly 150 pages, in a FOLDER. The wo "MACKELWAY" is written across the front. He leans down, opens the folder. The light is spotty out here... but it's just strong enough to show us the expres on his face: a look of pure awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open. The greasy bag and the soda fall to floor. Mackelway hurries to a phone, clutching that file. dials hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. FRAN'S CAR
dialogues.text: We're in a PARKING LOT outside a WAL-MART. Fran's just th a bag into her Ford Taurus. Her CEL-PHONE RINGS. She grab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kulok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really was FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan. He left his file on my doorstep. Fran, he was FBI. He can barely believe it himself, but we get a look at wh was in that file now; PAGES are splayed across Mackelway' coffee table: A copy of an FBI I.D. BADGE, xeroxed memoes, test scores, citations, evaluations, reports. The entire career of Spe Agent Benjamin O'Ryan... in black and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm look at his whole history! Citations, letters of commendation, even his fucking test scores from Quantico. The guy was an agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we hear a BEEP. Call-Waiting. Great. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Hold on. That irritated her. Mackelway clicks over. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? O'RYAN (THRU PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read anything interesting lately? Mackelway's eyes go wide. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? CLICK. O'Ryan's just hung up. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He stares at the phone, then clicks over again, re-connec to Fran. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was him. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called you at home? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. BEEP. Call-Waiting again. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Call me back. Mackelway clicks over again without saying goodbye. MACKELWAY (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan? O'RYAN (THRU PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found him, you know. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero's a myth. You made him up. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myths don't kidnap little boys. Do they? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Sounds like O'Ryan just laughed... Then, another curve: O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she pretty? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could hear her moaning, right under the Navajo chanting. Whole thing was downright tribal. What's she look like? That was unsettling. Very. Mackelway looks around feeling violated, feeling "watched." He draws the blinds. Double the front door. Runs his hand under the window frame for kind of wire tapping. But Mackelway won't allow himself to over-react. Not now, O'Ryan on the phone. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) You tell me. O'Ryan laughs. He liked that. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. We'll stick to business: How'd ya like my old room? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hope House." You were there. How the hell did he know that? It's unsettling. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyson re-paint it? (no reply) My room. Did he re-paint it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But you saw what was underneath, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You tell me. CLICK. O'Ryan just hung up. Mackelway stares at the phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More rain falls outside. Lightning too. Mackelway waits h Piper's in his usual spot in front of the TV. Dyson desce the stairs, a bit testy tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back. That had some edge. Mackelway doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway stands in the center of this room, Dyson in the doorway. That SINGER down the hall is at it again, off-ke ever. Tonight it's the "Gilligan's Island" theme-song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in my office. Dyson backs away, leaving the door ajar. Now Mackelway is alone - eyeing the tiny bed, sink, windo the leaky ceiling, the bucket, the peeling paint. This ro heaving with energy... He sits on the bed, checks his watch. 9:05 p.m. Opposite this bed is that WALL, re-painted in industrial white, with the hint of a shape underneath. It's what Mackelway's come here to investigate. INTERCUT WITH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan sits at a desk: eyes closed, writing pad at his wr On it, more of those unidentifiable lines become visible us. They're called IDEOGRAMS. He holds the point of his pen down upon one of them, as i receiving information from it, and we jump back into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway. Sitting. Staring. Outside this room we hear th awful, toneless singing as it fills the hallway. Mackelway rises, approaching that re-painted wall. He pul out his keys. Checks to see that no one's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan, his pen on that pad, his concentration total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the singing, the TV, the rain, that bucket collec drips. Semi-darkness... until MORE LIGHTNING throws a bur white light against that wall. A faint shape becomes visible, just beneath the white pai Then it vanishes again. Using his keys, he begins to scratch away at the white pa It's an irrational thing to do - but in the context of th last few days it makes an odd kind of sense. Instantly, a hint of BLACK can be seen underneath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan, at that desk. Outside, he can hear an 18-WHEEL TR rumble by. He doesn't allow it to distract him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway scratches more of the white paint off of that w More BLACKNESS appears beneath it. Then, a SOUND behind h He turns. The door to this room just SHUT; someone outside must've pushed it. He keeps scratching at the paint. LIGHTNING rages outside. We PULL BACK, away from that wal which gives us the opportunity to see something that Mack is too close to the wall to see for himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is indeed an image beneath that thin coat of white paint. It is the shape of a vast, black WAVE. A hand-pain image as large as this wall itself. Mackelway seems tiny by comparison, and the mere inch of that he has uncovered so far seems infinitesimal. In fact, it almost look as if the wave is poised to swall him whole... and he can't even see it. But we can. Must've taken O'Ryan days to paint something large. A vast, black wave. Evil itself... And Mackelway, without meaning to, is about to unleash it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan, somehow, seems to be sensing what is going on in room. Or maybe he's just feeling the power of that wave, memory. Or maybe he's just plain crazy. But he and Mackelway, on some unspoken psychic level, are feeding one another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway chips away at that white paint, moving rapidly, revealing more of the blackness underneath. We PUSH IN on moving past Mackelway and his frantic scraping. Then we're beneath that thin coat of white, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, we've submerged into the wave itself. A black, t force of nature. And it is MOVING. Alive. We hear the SOUNDS of it: a suck a yawning, as if a tide were drawing back just before exploding forward. The sounds blend in with the wind, the rain, the drops in bucket... Evil itself, on the move, gathering might. And along for the ride... The wave begins to roll forward now as if shot from a can It is massive, powerful, dark. And we're right on its for edge, as if surfing it somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan reacts. Something just changed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave is rushing us forward with this speed and power tsunami. ...which is when we hear the laughter of a LITTLE BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan just heard it too. Then new images come at him - b they are, at first, GRAINY, CHOPPY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of that wave become fainter, receding to the background, giving way to that sound of laughter, and the squeaking of a PLAY-SET SWING. Like an old tv slowly gaining reception, the image takes moment to crystallize before us. But then it sharpens: We're in the PLAY AREA of a TRUCK-STOP DINER, but it feel like we're looking at it through a broken lens. The image appear SPHERICAL to us, surrounded by darkness. Before us a 5-year old plays on a swing. Call him CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway has scraped away more of the white paint now - enough to see the outline of the front edge of the black its lip. He continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan tightens. We can't tell if he experiencing somethi from the past, the present, the future...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We WHIP AROUND quickly, getting a look into the diner its There, through a window, we see a WOMAN, presumably Charl mother. Her name's KATHLEEN, 40. Kathleen has her back turned to us, because she's busy diapering her nine month-old BABY at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan, at his desk, seems to be getting all of this. And is agitating him. There's perspiration on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of that wave is still a presence. Charlie looks at us as he swings. His smile is pure, genuine. We whip around for another look at Kathleen. She's still with that diaper. Then we look back to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan keeps his eyes shut, his focus total... but every of him is becoming tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway is beginning to perspire from the effort. More that wave is visible to him. But he doesn't step back to that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That swing is now EMPTY, dangling gently. And we're runni we know not where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan's foot starts to tap: anxiousness, discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We run... toward a PARKING LOT. But we do so smoothly, wi effort, as if being carried by that relentless black wave Then, ANOTHER SOUND bleeds in. The BANGING of the Diner's door, which leads on to that Play Area. And we hear a horrified yell:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie?! Charlie, where are you, Honey?! (fainter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie?! Honey, are you out here?! The sound begins to break up as if on a bad radio, being over by the sounds of that awful WAVE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway suddenly stops... as if some electric charge ha just shot through him, short-circuiting him into stillnes begins to step away from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan has lost the "pulse" - the connection that had all him inside what we just witnessed. He rises, hurrying into a tiny bathroom. We STAY ON THAT WRITING PAD, trying to decipher these lines and squiggles the ideograms - as we hear the sounds of O'Ryan, retching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway sits on the bed, looking at what he's just uncovered. An awesome sight. His head is pounding worse t ever... so he reaches for the Vicoden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've stepped out of that SUBJECTIVE POV now. Kathleen gr her infant, distraught, as another massive 18-WHEEL TRUCK blows by us in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan washes his face, eyes his reflection in the mirror scrutinizing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall opposite Mackelway, that huge black wave is n entirely visible to him. Bits of chipped white paint litt the floor. A vast black wave. It fills the whole wall... Mackelway eyes his watch. It's one o'clock in the morning He's been in here for four hours. That seems impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a box, slamming down hard on a desk. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2:30 a.m. Mackelway is in here by himself, angry. He reac into that box. Inside? More pins. BLACK ONES. He crosses the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts pulling out the YELLOW PINS we've grown accusto to seeing on this map, replacing them with the BLACK ONES tossing the discards onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: ...as Mackelway replaces pin after pin. ...Mackelway's face, as he backs away from that huge map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes have passed, but Mackelway has seen a revelat We can read it on his face. He eyes the map... which has now been stuck with over 1,0 BLACK PINS, one for each city with a HAVE YOU SEEN ME to credit. And those black pins, seen from a distance, form a patter weren't expecting - something that never quite took shape the pins were yellow. Looks like a big black WAVE. And that's just what it is. 1,000 black dots conspiring to form the same exact shape O'Ryan had painted onto the wall of his room - a massive of darkness, gathering strength. But this black wave is consuming America... Mackelway stares at it: awed, even a bit frightened. The seems vast, unstoppable... A black wave - pure malevolenc covering the states like a fog. One blue dot lies in its center: that blue pin, in the he of Greenville, Texas. Then, piercing the silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got one of those pins in Denton yet? Mackelway turns. Charlton leans in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan was spotted there tonight. Took a squad-car and a side-arm from a State Trooper. 'Bout an hour later a five-year old boy was abducted, roughly a mile up the Interstate. It's 3 a.m. What's this guy doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle was found in an abandoned lot. We're establishing a perimeter around the city now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows already) But the Trooper wasn't hurt... CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professional courtesy. Charlton's at a loss... until Mackelway gestures to the t where he has laid out O'Ryan's entire FBI File. Every mem citation, letter, i.d. picture. 150 pages. Charlton eyes it, calmly. He's not going to let his jaw d not with Mackelway watching. So he just nods. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that... possible, Sir? An agent can just be deleted? CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it. Mackelway pauses. It's a depressing reality... MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't understand it before - pushing Speck's car onto the state line. Makes sense now. He wanted to make the case Federal. He's drawing us in. CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he do that? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'd be paying attention when he found Suspect Zero. CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know what? I'm getting extremely tired of hearing that word. In fact, that's gonna be policy from now on. No Zero. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, profile the guy. He's straight outta Quantico. All he's doing is working a case, like we would. He's not kidnapping little kids - he's chasing the guy who's doing the kidnapping! Look at the map!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you saying - that all these abductions are the work of one guy? Do you know how fucking insane that is?! (over Mackelway) Not let's try something that actually makes sense: He sends in these faxes, picks off three scumbags. For what?! So we'll think exactly what you're thinking right now - that we've got a friend out there, somebody willing to take out the garbage for the rest of us. And it's all horse-shit! MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it isn't? What if there really is a Zero out there and O'Ryan's the one guy who's got a shot at him? CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just blew his top) Fuck's sake, Mackelway - when did you start buying into this guy?! A beat. Mackelway lets the silence hover. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) He's smarter than we are. CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself. Charlton heads for the door. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? What if I told you I knew how to catch him? Charlton stops. Turns. CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if I told you that the way I'd catch him involved sitting in a dark room, with nothing in front of me but a pad of paper... until I'd tapped into some kind of... energy out there. The collective unconscious. Something. If I told you I thought I could target and (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: locate him, without ever leaving this building, what would you say? CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you'd watched too many "X-Files." MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'ever heard of a project called "Icarus," Sir? CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mackelway tosses over a few pages from O'Ryan's file. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents, trained to "see" distant locations using nothing but the mind. They called it Remote Viewing. Charlton eyes the pages without comment. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army stole it from the Soviets. The Bureau stole it from the Army - used it to track serial killers. (a beat) Experimental program. O'Ryan was the first agent they recruited. CHARLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for him. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voodoo, right? Pure Bullshit. (Charlton's waiting) ...except, it worked. It's how he drew this: Mackelway's referring to that DRAWING: a steamer-trunk, f with ghastly Ziploc bags: MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd never been in that house before. He just saw what was in there - the Bureau taught him how... same one that deleted him. Same one that's trying to catch him now... Does anything about all this strike you as odd? Charlton studies him, a long beat, measuring him... Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Denton at Oh-Six-Hundred. You can take the day off. With that, he's gone - leaving Mackelway alone in here. Nothing to look at but that black wave... He hears Charlt leaving the building. He slams another Vicoden, then hears a PHONE RING. Fuck i He's not moving. Let Voice Mail get it. ...until he hears the sound of a FAX coming in. He rises. Follow him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway hurries through the office, as the sound of tha grows louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters. The fax has spun out a single sheet. No top-sh That's odd... But here's another face, another victim, with the customa HAVE YOU SEEN ME? across the top. A young African-American boy: "Lloyd Simms, Age 9. Ht. 4' Wt. 67 lbs. Last Seen: Greenville, Texas. Date of Disappearance: 10-26-99." That's it. One face. The transmission ends. Mackelway eye those vitals. They mean something. Greenville...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He re-enters, and approaches that huge MAP. There's that of black pins, with the one BLUE PIN in its center; Greenville, with a "10-26" written beside it. Mackelway pulls out the lone blue pin, replaces it with a black one. Now the wave is complete. All black...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: We've seen this truck before - several times in fact. It rumbles along the highway. We don't see who's driving, bu do see who's in the passenger seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Charlie, five years-old, whose abduction we just witnessed. He sleeps fitfully. A MAN'S HAND can be seen, edging into frame - the DRIVER. picks up a CASSETE, shoves it into the tape deck. And out comes the sound of "Barney the Dinosaur."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh silly songs get sillier/When you hear them once again/And maybe you're hearing an echo/Or maybe it's only a friend! The truck continues to rumble along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6 a.m. Fran pauses outside the O'Ryan Room... where Macke sleeps on a chair. Poor guy was here all night. She regards him... then her eyes find that MAP, and the g black wave across it. A horrible image... She studies Mackelway again, almost tenderly, until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he listen to you? She turns, startled. Here's Charlton, right behind her. A she's been caught... watching Mackelway sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a strength of his. I'm noticing that lately. Truth is, she doesn't like Charlton. Or trust him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughtta sit him down, remind him how a chain-of-command works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him. With that, he's gone. Fran watches as he heads for the Fr Door... and exits. She looks back to Mackelway. He awakens with a start. Thi no one's watching, he pops another Vicoden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran enters, feeling slightly dirty from that exchange. Mackelway checks his watch as a few AGENTS exit the suite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They going to Denton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in on two autopsies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. He rises. Heads for the door, stiff. She looks at those O FBI DOCUMENTS NOW - her first time seeing them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She leaves it at that. He's about to exit, when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they male or female?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The autopsies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Females - Logan, Utah; and Decatur, Alabama. (Neither city is represented with black pins on that map. She slides over a packet of PHOTOS: two FEMALE VICTIMS, photographed in separate morgues - face up, face down, wa and above, waist and below, etc. Mackelway eyes them, then leaves the room. We STAY WITH FRAN... taking in that O'Ryan FBI file. It troubles her. Mackelway returns, carrying the 9-by-12 envelope that Kat gave to him. FRAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: O'Ryan's file) So is this what happens when an agent spins out? He gets deleted? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. The lucky ones get sent to Wichita Falls. She breathes out an ironic laugh. He hands over the envel opens it. Inside: that photo of Karen Sumpter. Mackelway didn't pay much attention to it before. Fran eyes the photo, then the vitals. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of the Receptionist, missing for about a year now. I told her I'd let her know if the body ever turned up. Fran doesn't look up from the photo. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Katie. She half-smiles: "You mean the one you've been fucking?" shrugs, confirming nothing - wishing Fran weren't quite s smart. She puts the photo back into the envelope. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you got the blue pin out of Greenville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Last night. Kid named Simms. That confused her. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Sumpter) No. I meant her. The girl. That confused him. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ya look at her vitals? She hands him the material on Karen Sumpter. FRAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greenville, Texas. October 26. He grabs the material, looks at it for the first time: "Karen Sumpter, Age 25. Ht. 5'6", Wt. 110. Eyes Blu, Hair Blnd. Last Seen: Greenville, Tx. Date of Disappearance: 1

Mackelway looks to the Conference Table - that huge stack faxes, all those helpless faces. The one on top is the one that came in last night: Lloyd Simms, Age 9. Ht. 4'10", Wt. 67 lbs. Last Seen: Greenvill Texas. Date of Disappearance: 10-26-99. At last, a pattern. A break. Mackelway grabs the Simms fax, hurries out of the room. Nearest Agent is Grieves. Mackelway hands him the fax. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need an address on this fax line. Grieves has done this on fifty different faxes now; it ne yields their suspect, but: GRIEVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay. Mackelway leans back in to the O'Ryan Room. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan's in Greenville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think so? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where Zero is. (Fran's a blank) Lloyd Simms - October 26, '99. Karen Sumpter - October 26, 2000. Both disappeared from Greenville. (still no reply) Zero comes back to the same spot, once a year. Today's the 25th. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. When did we establish that Zero was real? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan thinks so. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? That's the million-dollar question, and it hangs there. Mackelway's about to answer... when he stops himself. Jus noticing something. That MORGUE PHOTO from Logan, Utah: There's a BURN MARK on the lower left calf of the victim. We've seen such a mark before, on another autopsy photo. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen this before. FRAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? He doesn't answer, just hurries to a thick BOX OF OTHER AUTOPSY FILES AND PHOTOS. Starts rifling through them... ...until he finds the one we've seen before. The body fro Trenton. He extracts it. Eyes it. A confirmation... He lays the two PHOTOS side by side. Looks to Fran. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same burn-mark. (she leans in) I saw it before but it didn't register. Fran eyes the photos. No doubt about it - they both have same burn mark on the lower left calf: a symmetrical, alm horizontal stripe across the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He burns them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Almost looks too symmetrical to be a burn. (re: Logan victim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're autopsying her this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She gets the idea: "Find out where the hell this mark on leg came from." Grieves enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fax number traces back to a Copy Center on I-30. Greenville. (Mackelway eyes his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called. They don't open for another hour. Mackelway looks to Fran. She's not entirely sold yet... b she's getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway plows along I-30. Ahead of him, one hell of an ugly STORM-FRONT seems to be waiting. Thick, black clouds. Mackelway's driving right i the teeth of them...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A copy-place, right off I-30. Mackelway's Yukon is parked front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway stands opposite a DAY-MANAGER: 30, harried, eye copy of the composite drawing of O'Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: O'Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naah. I never saw that guy in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sent a fax from this location 'bout seven o'clock this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed at seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your faxes programmable? Could he have paid last night to have it sent this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. But that costs extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you here last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Haven't done nights since I got promoted. Mackelway eyes the guy... then hears a CEL-PHONE ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me. Mackelway grabs his cel, backing away from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. MORGUE
dialogues.text: Fran is at a phone, in the Morgue. The Logan Utah BODY li the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a burn. It's a freezer-burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's crystallization in the blood stream. The blood never clotted in the wound. It's a freezer burn... I'm having the other body shipped out - the guy from Trenton. We'll see if he's got the same thing. Mackelway pauses, thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... he keeps the bodies in a freezer, then buries them...? That was a question. He can't do any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. If he kept them in a freezer they'd have marks like this all over. Wouldn't they? Mackelway nods - that made sense. Shit. The noise of the Interstate doesn't make things any easie huge TRUCK rumbles by. 18 wheels. Mackelway eyes it, absently. Then a bolt hits him: On the side of the truck is a trademark: "EVER-FROST." Th truck is hauling ice cream. Things just began to click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Fran. He has hit "End" before she can reply. Heads to his Yukon Fran eyes the phone: that was odd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge lay-out, with a diner, rest-stop, and gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway sits at a table by a window. Watching. FIFTY MA TRUCKS in this lot - some refrigerated, most not. This Diner is big enough to seat 200: truckers, a few families, and folks who just like the buffet, (gravy cove just about every entree.) Mackelway's been here for hours. A WAITRESS comes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some more breakfast, Honey, or are we just rollin' right on into lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some coffee, thanks. Might hit the buffet in a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meatloaf's lookin' good today. He smiles, thanks. She turns away. That leaves him alone again, scanning - not even sure he's in the right place. CEL-PHONE RINGS. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. FRAN'S CAR
dialogues.text: She's driving, talking into the cel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveilling. What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving to Greenville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows already)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you be doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think agents are safer when they have some company. I can send along Katie if you'd rather. Mackelway laughs. He appreciates a good jab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the truck-stop we traced. Off the I-30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm 'bout a half hour out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll order some lunch for you. Hear the meatloaf's good today. She half-smiles. She likes him, despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: DINER
dialogues.text: He half-smiles, puts the cel-phone away. He likes her, de himself. Then a MAN passes by him, a trucker. Let's call him VIC. All we see as he passes is the TATTOO on his forearm: a c Keys jingle on his belt-hook. He wears a sleeveless down and a "God Bless America" cap. Mackelway turns, but Vic's already past us. Something about him attracts Mackelway's attention. The w the attitude. Something. So Mackelway is watching - without really knowing why - a crosses the parking lot, heading for his rig. It's a beas Vic climbs in, unaware that he's being watched. Mackelway looks away, chiding himself for allowing the gu distract him. That WAITRESS comes by with more coffee. Mackelway smiles, looking absently out the window again. And sees a LITTLE BOY of 5, in the cab of Vic's rig... But this little boy is SCREAMING, struggling to get out o car-seat, until Vic grabs the kid by the shoulders, rough all of this visible through the windshield. Mackelway locks in on the kid. Holy shit... Vic's rig pulls out. The kid pounds on his window. Looks he's saying "Lemme out of here! I want my Mommy!" He migh little Charlie - we can't tell from here. But we can see that Vic is yelling at him: "Shut up!" And we can see that Vic's truck is refrigerated. He's hau dairy products. On a normal day, Mackelway might shrug this off as coincidence. He might not be so vigilant. This isn't a normal day. He races for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway backs out in the Yukon, trying to keep a visual Vic's truck. ANOTHER 18-WHEELER pulls in front of him, blocking his vi entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! He honks - loud - pulls around that other 18-wheeler, hea for the exit of the lot. Just spotted Vic's rig again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows Vic's rig out of the lot and onto a road approaching I-30. But there are three cars between them - Mackelway can't get a clean look at Vic's license plate. Vic approaches the Interstate. So do the three cars betwe them. Vic passes the Interstate on-ramp. The three cars turn on it... putting Mackelway right on Vic's tail. He grabs his cel, dials. This truck has license plates fr ten states.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mackelway. I need a run down on a plate. Texas: Delta-142-Romeo-Victor- Alpha. Got that? He puts the cel down, but doesn't hang up. Vic just made turn onto a VAST DIRT LOT. A huge BANNER overhead reads, "FOUNDERS DAY CARNIVAL!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several BIG-RIGS parked here, but the vast majo of the vehicles we see are garden-variety cars and SUV's. few pick-ups. There are RIDES at this carnival: Pony rides, a ferris wh and a huge ring of Barbeques, each fired up and cooking. be a thousand people in attendance today. Vic parks his rig. Mackelway hangs back, watching: Vic gets out of the rig. From here we can see that that 5 old BOY is still stick in his car seat, and he is still screaming and flailing. Vic points a stern finger at the kid as if to say, "Behav else." Then Vic disappears into the crowded carnival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the Yukon, approaching Vic's truck. We CRO THE LOT WITH HIM. He reaches Vic's truck, looks in the passenger window. Th the five year-old kid, tears streaming down his face. (We still can't tell if it's Charlie.) Mackelway reaches for the passenger-side door. It's locke course. And he can't shoot his way in. He looks to the kid inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? (Kid's a blank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid? You okay in there? The Kid doesn't respond - just seems spooked. Shit... Mackelway looks into the heart of that crowd. Vic's still visible to us, but he won't be for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the Kid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back. Don't worry. Mackelway heads into the carnival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins running now, past the table where ladies are se TICKETS for the rides and games, past the Cotton-Candy Gu Running... because we just lost sight of Vic. Mackelway hurries through that ring of barbeques, upsetti tray or two. Then he stops. There's the ferris wheel. Was Vic on the other side of it? Mackelway takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Vic. But Mackelway thinks he sees the guy... heading b in the direction of the parking lot. He runs past the Pony rides, past a funhouse, past a popc machine, past those ladies selling tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a bottleneck of people at the entrance. But he bu through, runs into the dirt parking lot, around cars and rigs, then turns a corner and: ...runs smack into Benjamin O'Ryan. The shock is so total it takes each of them a moment to recover from it. But here he is. O'Ryan, five feet away. Mackelway's speechless, still trying to recalibrate himse second ago he was chasing a possible Zero. Now he's face face with O'Ryan. And O'Ryan isn't running. In fact, he almost seems amused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well... Must be quite a moment for you. Congratulations. Mackelway still hasn't spoken, until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for you. ...which is when Mackelway realizes that he is standing r in front of Vic's rig. But he wasn't expecting what comes next: Vic has returned to the rig, with a WOMAN beside him. Tur out, she's his WIFE. Vic opens the passenger-side door, unclasps that five year-old kid from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy! The kid dives into the Woman's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you she'd be here. (to Woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been a brat all morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother hugs son... which means that Mackelway has misread things, badly. And O'Ryan is a witness to it - hence the grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at O'Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands up. O'Ryan raises his hands. Mackelway reaches for his cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan's hands are cuffed in front of him. Mackelway lead to the Yukon, opens a door for him, and puts him into the backseat. A few LOOKIE-LOU'S strain for a peek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway gets in, hits the ignition. Reaches for his cel phone. Starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awfully conventional - don't ya think? Mackelway pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apprehend the fugitive, then call it in for your pat on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you. Mackelway continues to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get over it. (flat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not too sure that little boy will. Bang. That just stopped Mackelway, mid-dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (minor test)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What little boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one from the Diner, in Denton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same way I found Starkey, and Speck, and Fulcher... and you. That rang a bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need someplace quiet - someplace I can concentrate... And your assurance that once he's located, we go get him together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I can't help you. Mackelway, disgusted, pulls out of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through sparse traffic, heading for an Interstate on-ramp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about uncompromised justice. No trials. No lawyers. No hiccups in a chain of evidence that can set a monster free. You of all people should be able to appreciate the value of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be doing this much longer. Actually, this is the end of it. I've

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come to accept that. But there is one last thing to-- MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anger rising) Where's the boy, O'Ryan? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have an understanding? Mackelway pulls the car over, under an I-30 overpass... a out comes his gun, pointed right at O'Ryan's forehead. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this shit. Where's the boy? O'Ryan can't help it. He's pleased. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. This is good. Sort of thing you'd never find in a procedural manual. It tells me I was right about you. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocking the hammer) I will kill you, O'Ryan. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But we have work to do first. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Goddamn kid?!?! Silence... Then that CEL-PHONE rings. Must be Fran. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pick that up. Mackelway eyes him: are you kidding? It rings again. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a panicked offer) This is the guy who put all those pins in that map of yours! And I can take you to him! Ring #3. Mackelway grabs the phone. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Where is he? (silence) Where is he?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence, punctuated by Ring #4. Then O'Ryan smiles... and points to his own forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here... Mackelway lets out a disgusted sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. He punches the "Talk" button, taking his eyes off O'Ryan split second. ...What follows is a blur: O'Ryan lunges forward like an animal, throwing his cuffed wrists over Mackelway's head, yanking Mackelway out of hi seat with a violent tug. The gun falls. We POP OUTSIDE THE YUKON, pulling back... obscuring our v of what's going on inside that truck. That cel-phone continues to ring... We keep pulling back, under this sparsely-trafficked overpass, rain falling. The cel-phone stops ringing. CONTINUE PULLING BACK, takin the expanse of highway - cars rolling by without a hint o peril beneath them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran has just arrived. She scans the place. Doesn't see Mackelway. Great. She reaches for that cel-phone again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway awakens. The room feels like it's swimming. His and legs are bound. His mouth has been GAGGED. And he is staring into his own REFLECTION. He lies on his side. A MIRROR has been propped on the flo just inches from his face - leaving him with nothing to l at but himself. He strains against the ropes, but there's no give to them He's helpless, powerless. And that mirror is forcing him watch it all with perfect clarity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few feet away, O'Ryan sits in a chair, calmly peeling t skin off of an apple with that huge HUNTING KNIFE of his. CANDLE flickers on the floor by his feet. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid? There was a delight to that question - we can see it on O'Ryan's face. Mackelway, of course, can't reply due to t gag. But the answer's obvious. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quoting himself, as Daitz:) "Imagine a killer with no patterns, no tell-tale fetishes, no rituals of any kind. No hidden desire to be caught. A perfect vessel of evil." All Mackelway can see is his own reflection - the fear in eyes - bouncing off a mirror that's only inches away. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the name we give that killer... is Zero. (again:) Are you afraid? Slowly, he lowers the knife into the flame of that candle the floor. It GLOWS. Good God... O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be customary at this point to start praying. I hear a lot of that. Haven't seen too many answers though. I wouldn't hold my breath waiting for another janitor to break in here and save you, either. You're alone. Mackelway tries to speak. It's impossible. O'Ryan pulls the GAG from his mouth, just long enough for Mackelway to say: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the boy? O'Ryan jams the gag back into his mouth, angrily. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the mirror) My, my. Must be extremely satisfying to watch yourself say something so heroic. I'm almost envious. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) The boy's under the bed. In pieces. Are you afraid? Mackelway absorbs that - watches himself absorb it - then looks to that bed. Can't quite see what's under it... O'Ryan eyes the flames as they dance over the blade. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking: "There is pain coming. Am I going to take it like a man?" Let me put you at ease: You won't. None of them do. Men, women, children. They all weep, they all beg. They pass out, they piss themselves. They attempt negotiation: You wouldn't believe how many men have lain right where you're lying right now - grown men, with wives and children back home - offering all kinds of sexual gratification in exchange for a five minute reprieve. It's pathetic. Are you afraid? (of course, no reply) Then there's that moment when they realize there's nothing left to be negotiated. They're just mine. And they're helpless. And the look in their eyes, the level of surrender... well, it's almost pornographic. I put this mirror here because I don't want you to miss it. Are you afraid? With that, he lifts that hunting knife out of the flame. RED-HOT. Even looking at it is painful. But Mackelway can't look at anything else. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about now? Just like that, that red-hot knife is an inch from Mackel face. The heat alone makes his head jerk back. Wisps of s rise from its edge. And Mackelway is forced to watch his own reaction to it. He struggles against these ropes, to no use. A guttural s comes out of him. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan's hand lashes out a bit, leaving the sizzling knif just under Mackelway's chin. The anticipation of pain is unbearable. And Mackelway is reading it in his own eyes.. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm? Agent Mackelway? Are you? Two things hit at once: 1) This monster is about to tortu to death. 2) Please, God, don't let me give him the satisfaction of seeing me cry... O'Ryan moves the blade again, this time an eighth of an i above Mackelway's right arm. The heat from it is so incen that Mackelway's shirt begins to smoke. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? Mackelway's shirt is officially on fire now. The pain is awful. He stares at his own reflection. ...as tears begin to flow from his eyes. He can't stop th O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (top of his lungs) Are you afraid?! That bounces off the walls. Mackelway shuts his eyes tigh can't watch this anymore. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (infuriated) Open your eyes! Open your eyes Goddammit or I'll cut the fucking lids off!! Mackelway opens his eyes, forced to watch himself break. sobs shudder through him, as... O'Ryan digs that red-hot blade into Mackelway's arm: O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU AFRAID
dialogues.text: Mackelway sees the answer in his own reflection: Yes, I a terrified. He SHRIEKS, the sound muffled by that gag. With his body able to do no more than spasm, he jerks his forward, smashing it into that mirror. THE MIRROR SHATTER obliterating the image. ...and everything goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, MORE IMAGES SWARM AT US. We're helpless to beat the back: 180a EXT. DARKNESS - UNIDENTIFIED TIME Out of a soupy darkness, a dreamlike spin on a location w visited before: It is the wheat field that O'Ryan has Rem Viewed countless times. Only this time we see it through Mackelway's fever, or nightmare... We see the tall wheat, wet wind - familiar images to us. All to the pounding Cha the Navaho. But then OTHER IMAGES enter this world. They're jarring: -That TRIBESMAN, eyes rolling back, foaming the mouth, dancing around a fire in a frenzy. Then a curtain of whea obscures him, revealing: -Fran, and Katie, giggling, crooking fingers as if inviti us. Looks like they're naked. But as we approach them, th seem to get farther away. Then that curtain of wheat that separates us from them reveals: -Charlton, extending a hand to us, warmly, congratulating for something, a job well done, when: Mackelway himself is hunting through the wet wheat, gun d He FIRES... Then looks to see who he's just shot. A body. He turns it over. ...and is staring at himself, lying dead on the ground in mud and pouring rain. It is a moment of shock and horror, giving way as we... 181   FADE UP AGAIN... ...on O'Ryan - at a desk, sitting upright, making notes o pad. Calm. Businesslike. His back turned to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. We don't know how much. Or maybe we're d or dreaming. It's hard to say... But there's O'Ryan, at a desk. Writing... Mackelway's eyes are open. His FOREHEAD has a bright red raspberry on it from smashing into that mirror. But the brain is functioning. It starts running through a check-list:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the same motel room. I'm on a bed. I'm alive. Ther O'Ryan. Everything hurts. No, it's just my right arm. But is searing. The check-list continues: my mouth is sore, but that GAG been removed. And MY ARMS ARE UNBOUND. Legs too. Maybe I am dead. Mackelway tries to move his hand. It takes some effort. Everything's foggy. But he puts it before his face. Turns Flexes it. Squeezes it. His hand... He stares at it. Then he notices his SHOULDER. A fat BANDAGE has been wrap around it - covering up the source of that searing pain. as though a nurse had tended to it. But this sure as hell isn't a hospital... Then, O'Ryan turns, facing us. Mackelway recoils without meaning to. But O'Ryan's demeanor has changed. That look of possessed malevolence - it's gone now. We can't imagine why. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Stand up. Mackelway pauses, rewinding that one. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over now. Can you stand? Mackelway is still bracing for torture, or at least comba he's a step behind. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really do have to go. O'Ryan rises, crossing toward us. Even unbound, Mackelway expecting another onslaught... But all O'Ryan does is dro piece of paper onto Mackelway's lap. It's another DRAWING: of a RANCH-HOUSE, with a windmill i background. Crude, but just specific enough. Mackelway's too unwound to speak... O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he'll be. With the boy. (a beat) Zero. He's coming home today. We're going to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway's starting to understand now. This was an act. initiation. That stuns him... O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ready to come with me now. You've been in the pit. Stand up. Mackelway eyes him - utter disbelief. O'Ryan smiles warmly - like a Drill Sergeant at the end o Basic: Sorry I was so hard on you but it had to be done.. we shake on it? Instead, Mackelway simply EXPLODES: It is a blur, faster than a blur, but Mackelway rises wit animal roar, knocking O'Ryan flat on his back. Then Mackelway is upon him.
