All the helplessness, all the horror, the images of watch himself in that mirror, the sounds of his own uncontrolla sobbing... they ERUPT now into violence. It is an overwhelming force. O'Ryan can't begin to fight off. Mackelway has one hand on O'Ryan's throat. The other comes down like a sledgehammer. One blow. Then another. The sounds coming out of Mackelwa savage, barely human. He's out of control. O'Ryan's eyes roll back. Mackelway now puts both hands ar this fucker's throat. He's going to kill him - right here He's going to squeeze the life from him. This is a Mackelway we've never met before. His eyes are hateful - even as the last gasps of breath rasp their way of O'Ryan's throat. Then Mackelway is distracted, for just a second. No. Less a second... by a glimpse of that SHATTERED MIRROR - his o twisted image. He looks away from it, refusing to be distracted, determi to kill this guy. ...then those eyes drift back to the mirror again. ...and he sees his reflection: a hardened, crazed strange animal. His hands, without warning, release their grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan gasps for air. His face has been bloodied. Mackelw rises, disgusted, removing a great weight from O'Ryan's c That makes breathing a little easier. Mackelway crosses to a tiny, cheap BATHROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway enters. There's a mirror in here too. That fat BANDAGE on his shoulder stares back at him. He tugs at it - doesn't unravel it, just yanks it off his revealing a hideous wound. It's a ZERO, WITH A SLASH THROUGH IT. Now everything clicks: O'Ryan was branding him. Initiatin with that red-hot knife. Mackelway stares at the wound, his eyes lifeless. He spla some water on his face, his mind still reeling. Then O'Ryan appears in the doorway. He too looks like hel face bloodied, throat red, eyes watering. A long beat... Mackelway eyes him, incredulous. O'Ryan nods, then places DRAWING of the Ranch-House on the sink. Mackelway eyes it Then O'Ryan stuns him... by laying Mackelway's GUN atop t drawing, without a word. Mackelway eyes the gun, then grabs it and points it right O'Ryan's face, just inches away. We're TIGHT on Mackelway's hand. It trembles with rage. But O'Ryan, looking right down the barrel, seems unafraid fact he smiles, utterly confident. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. I promise... But not yet. He eases Mackelway's hand down, thus lowering the gun. Th O'Ryan turns, grabs Mackelway's car keys, and heads for t front door. Mackelway stands, rigid. He raises the gun. Maybe I'll ju shoot this fucker in the back. Then those IMAGES come at us again, out of nowhere:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of a gray, soupy swirl - coming slightly into focus: wind, tall wheat, our own heavy BREATHING as we run... An that non-descript voice we heard echoing earlier becomes sound of O'Ryan's voice, static-filled, wobbling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I'm begging you. That was clear enough. A gun rises. We seem to be holding it... Then those images vanish, and we are jolted back to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway tightens. O'Ryan's out the door. This VISION th keeps getting clearer and clearer... What the hell does t it mean? Down go two more Vicodens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge STORM devours scenery on both sides of us. O'Ryan drives. Mackelway sits, no expression at all on his face, still recovering from what happened in that room... Silence... Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Icarus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... wanna know. O'Ryan eyes him. The sky is black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were five of us. In the program. Mackelway's all ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd come in in the morning, have a cup of coffee, talk about the Yankees. Then you'd go to your room, with your pen and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your pad of paper, always alone, and you'd try to lock in. Son of Sam. John Wayne Gacy. Ted Bundy. He might be driving his car, or having a beer or brushing his teeth... or cutting someone's eyes out. That was said flatly, matter-of-factly. It's chilling. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you did it right, you got all of it: The way it sounded. The way it smelled... Those people were looking up at you, begging you for mercy. It was like being God. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...except you're not. Because you can't do a thing for them. Can't make it stop. You're just watching, helpless. He pauses. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wired us into this current, the five of us: darkness, the pit itself. We were plugged right into it. But nobody taught us how to shut it off... (thinking back...) We were just men. And we saw things men shouldn't see. Agony, torture, evil - and it never shut off. Even now, it's still there. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all wind up like you? The other agents? O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're dead now. Oh. Mackelway doesn't reply... O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They broke down. Then they opted out. (Mackelway's a blank) Killed themselves... After a while, those conversations about the Yankees became impossible. Ya see? Mackelway lets that sink in, as he stares at passing head lights. Then: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan shrugs. He appreciates it. The windshield wipers b back rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan continues to drive. Silence hangs. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here. Mackelway sits up. O'Ryan pulls over at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've seen this place before. That is, we've seen it in O'Ryan's DRAWING, which lies on the dashboard before us: ranch-style house with a WINDMILL in the backyard. O'Ryan pulls over. Rain pounds on the roof and hood. Wind blows. Mackelway studies the house. Then his eyes shift briefly to the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't bring you in with me. You know that. O'Ryan shrugs, then raises his hands: "Cuff me." The CUFFS are lying on the floor in the back seat. Mackel reaches back, to grab them... a golden opportunity for O' to club the guy. But O'Ryan remains still. Mackelway grabs them. Then he s Simply has to ask:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those faxes, the Have-You-Seen-Me's... How many of 'em is he actually responsible for? O'Ryan lays it right out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of 'em. Mackelway nods, sobered. Cuffs O'Ryan to the steering whe and approaches the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is in some disrepair: untended lawn, chipping p etc. Mackelway looks through the kitchen window. No one's visible. He walks around the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan watches as Mackelway vanishes. This is a moment of opportunity. With his free hand, he reaches into his pock grabbing a lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway moves cautiously, being pelted by rain. But now can see inside the Living Room of this home: It's a bit of a time warp: plastic on the furniture, an o radiator, pictures on the mantle in antique frames. And an OLD LADY, leaning over a record player. Tough to hear what's playing - we're outside, and that st is pounding - but it sounds like Glenn Miller. There's al old tv in here: "Wizard of Oz" is on it. The lady is 70, frail, thin. She also happens to be BLIND Cataracts on her eyes. Her name's DELIA. Mackelway watche her... as she exits the room, heading for the kitchen. He moves to another window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan, keeping his eyes on that house, now lights the lighter... and holds the flame up to the CHAIN connecting hand-cuff to the one on the steering wheel. The chain begins to heat up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway watches as Delia makes her way into the kitchen It, too, is from another era: the dishwasher stands in th center of the floor, connected to the sink with a long ho The refrigerator, the table, the toaster - all old. The oven is an antique too. Delia crosses to it, grabs a towel, opens it... and pulls a CAKE from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings the cake to the kitchen table, moving well for lady who can't see. On the table is an old-fashioned bake frosting tube. She grabs it, using her hands to orient herself... and be to write on the cake, in frosting. Slowly. Mackelway can't see the top of that cake, but we can. The first letters, in beautiful cursive, read: "Happy Bir..." a work in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan has that handcuff chain GLOWING now. We don't know he'll have time to break the thing... until: The passenger-side door is opened, abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his birthday, isn't it? O'Ryan turns. Here's Mackelway, who now gets an eyeful of O'Ryan's doing with that lighter. O'Ryan pockets it, a bit sheepishly. Mackelway decides to ignore the whole thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes home on his birthday. O'Ryan nods. Then Delia's front door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aloud, delighted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling?! That you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delia stands in the open doorway: an old blind lady, talk to the dark rainy street. That confuses them. ...until we hear the rumble of an 18-WHEEL TRUCK. It turns a corner onto this street. Mackelway turns now.. We've seen this truck before. A monstrous, rolling beast. Mackelway straightens, reaching for his sidearm. Behind h Delia smiles excitedly, almost dancing. But that smile soon leaps from her face... as she hears t sound of that 18-wheeler, BRAKING ABRUPTLY, its tires loc up on the wet road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway gets a look at the DRIVER now - a wiry, sinewy of 35... Let's call him ZERO. Their eyes lock - until Zero throws his rig into gear aga and begins to rumble down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daryl? Honey? No answer. That truck is rumbling away. Mackelway turns, racing for the Yukon, leaving Delia at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway jumps in to the Yukon, unlocking those cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive. He accidentally burns himself on the super-heated chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: burn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Cuffs are unlocked now. O'Ryan starts up the Yukon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan drives, pursuing the big-rig. Mackelway gets on hi phone, dials. Rain falls in SHEETS all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mackelway! I'm travelling north on... Grove Road, approaching I-30 in Greenville. Request immediate back-up. Pursuing a suspect in a refrigerated truck, Texas license plate Alpha-- The Yukon swerves hard to the right, narrowly avoiding th tail end of Zero's rig as he swings it into our path. Mackelway drops the phone. Grabs it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha-4-5-2-Tango-Foxtrot-Alpha. Zero does it again - swinging the rear of his rig across road, forcing O'Ryan to swerve hard. The Yukon gets shove to a curb, then clunks down to the street again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Zero jams on the brakes. Mackelway's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at O'Ryan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brakes! O'Ryan jumps on the brakes. The Yukon screeches to a stop throwing itself into a sideways slide. It bangs, passenge side first, into the rear of the truck, breaking a window Mackelway ducks out of the way of breaking glass. Then th pulls away again. O'Ryan follows.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHASE
dialogues.text: Zero's rig turns hard onto a SERVICE ROAD, running parall the Interstate. Mackelway is locked in on that truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cel-phone again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travelling due west now. Don't see a name. It's a service road, running parallel to the-- Then Mackelway freezes, mid-word. He just saw something t made his jaw drop: On the other side of this road is a field of TALL WHEAT. Time seems to stop. His blood feels like it just congeale Tall wheat in a wet wind. He has been here before. He has it before. And so has O'Ryan... Mackelway just stares, slack-jawed, as that wheat whips p them. The feeling is so unsettling that for a moment he forgets about Zero, and the rig, and the kid... Everything has just crystallized in a horrible way. He kn that he is going to wind up in that wheat field, somehow, O'Ryan. And O'Ryan will be begging him for mercy. "Please..." O'Ryan guns the Yukon, attempting to cut in front of the Zero swings wide, sending the Yukon into a curb this time That shreds their front tire. ...which means that in one minute this car is going to be undriveable. So if they don't stop Zero from hitting that Interstate - now - Zero will be gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't let him hit the Interstate. Mackelway braces himself, as O'Ryan guns his car up the l side of the rig, shredded tire and all. Then: He pulls right in front of the rig. At about 60 m.p.h. An jams on the brakes. Zero swerves, out of instinct. It throws the rig into a vicious JACK-KNIFE. The van whips around in front of the swatting the Yukon away like a fly. We're inside the Yukon as it rolls, Mackelway and O'Ryan like tinker toys. The torque pulls Zero's rig onto its side, sliding hard. hits concrete, sending up a shower of SPARKS. The Yukon winds up in a ditch alongside the service road, upside down. Mackelway, alive and awake, strains to look the busted windshield. What he sees is hard to discern - but it looks like Zero' is lying flat on its side. And, of course, he is mere yards from that wheat field...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig's cab lies driver's-side down. But the passenger- door pops open. And Zero pokes through it, his eyes immediately scanning that TALL WHEAT. Rain pours. Mackelway's watching. O'Ryan, who blacked out for a secon opens his eyes, getting the picture in a hurry. Zero leaps to the ground, rolls, and rises. Only thing in hand is a TIRE IRON. Carrying it, he sprints into the whe field - vanishing. Mackelway bursts out of the Yukon, in pursuit. O'Ryan's d is stuck. Mackelway doesn't stop to help him - just barre across the street. Just then - a STATE RANGER CAR arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder, running)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the van open! He's got a kid in the van! STATE RANGER hurries out of his squad car. Mackelway spri into the tall wheat. O'Ryan, with a grunt, gets his door open. Now he too disappears into that Wheat Field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall wheat in a stiff wet wind, and not a drop of moonlig guide us. Mackelway plunges in, gun drawn. No idea where going. ...except he's been here before. He's seen it. And there feeling of inevitability to all this; it's haunting. He's practically blind in here. Can't see five feet in fr of him. Nothing but the sound of his own breathing. That, too, was presaged. Those visions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked. Ranger pulls out his handgun and blows the l away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway keeps running, deaf and blind. O'Ryan is running nearby, but they can't see or hear one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 sides of beef lie on their sides. Ranger plunges in. Then the Ranger spots, in the back of the van, a FALSE-WA that used to hide a secret compartment. The crash has collapsed part of the false-wall. Frozen ai blows out in wisps. He climbs over those carcasses, fast can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway keeps going, running blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, another sound, up ahead. Sounds like the noise of someone stumbling. Mackelway stops. Listens. Silence. The sound does not repeat itself. He continues along, step by cautious step now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ranger gets over the last of the carcasses, pulling himse to the now-open compartment. First thing we see is a REFRIGERATION ROD, the one that w responsible for those freezer burns. Then we see Charlie, bound. He's trembling with cold, but alive. His leg presses up against the rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway, inching along, heart pounding. He hears a nois his left. Whips around, gun poised. But it's nothing. He sighs. The wheat almost sounds like laughing at him. Then that TIRE IRON lashes out, from the right. It catches Mackelway with horrific force, shattering his and sending that gun flying into the wheat. Before Mackelway can react, Zero is upon him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran's Ford skids to a stop outside the van. ...just as the Ranger brings Charlie out of the rig. The is shaking, traumatized. He begins to cry... Fran gets the idea. She hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelway and Zero wrestle, surrounded and obscured by al that wheat... Zero is a monster, and he's got that tire i Mackelway has a busted wrist. Hardly a fair fight. But Mackelway is battling: kicking, clawing, getting in a many shots as he can. His shirt rips away from his body, exposing that brand-mark. They roll back and forth. Until

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, firmly) Up. Zero freezes. Mackelway too. They turn to find: O'Ryan... who stands here, Mackelway's gun in hand. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up. Mackelway's relief is total. He pushes Zero away, rising. pulls himself off the ground, chagrinned. ZERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Mackelway) Glad you're here, Man. Guy was about to kill me. O'Ryan, without ceremony, puts a bullet through Zero's le palm. That got Mackelway's attention. Zero howls with pain, his palm gushing. The TIRE-IRON fal the ground. Mackelway approaches O'Ryan. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here. He extends his good hand to O'Ryan: "The gun." O'Ryan pau Then... O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to shoot him? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the gun, O'Ryan. ZERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I just surrendered. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. ZERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I surrendered! That's it! O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: O'Ryan wheels around, aiming the gun right at Zero's face That shuts the guy up in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From that service road now, we hear a line of SIRENS, approaching from a distance. Unit after unit. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly now) Look at him, Mack. He's not human anymore. Go dig up that old lady's backyard - you'll find bodies there... Maybe hundreds of them. Of course, ya gotta get a warrant first, chain of custody's gotta be followed. One breach, and he walks. (no reply) My way, he's eliminated; the world is rid of him. It's a lot closer to justice than having some Prosecutor tell you you've left a tissue sample in the wrong lab. Isn't it? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that stung) Give me the fucking gun! O'Ryan turns, studies him. ...and hands him the gun. Just like that. Mackelway eyes it. O'Ryan doesn't say a word, just crosse back to Zero, and grabs that TIRE-IRON off the ground. O'Ryan's now standing right behind Zero, as: O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Mackelway) You have to understand: none of this was arbitrary. We were chosen, you and I. WHAP! O'Ryan just swung that tire-iron into Zero's rib ca We hear bones crack, and air rushing from the guy's lungs drops to his knees, gasping. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw us here. You did too. THUMP! Another violent swing of that tire-iron, busting u other side of Zero's torso. Now both sides of his rib-cag have shattered. Breathing is almost impossible. Mackelway tightens. His head just began to throb... MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You made your point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! If I'd made my fucking point you would've shot him yourself by now! Another swing of that tire-iron, across the back of Zero' neck. He crumbles, face down. Fuck it. Mackelway crosses to O'Ryan and puts that gun ri up against the back of O'Ryan's head. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Then, an odd thing... O'Ryan simply smiles. Something about having that gun pointed right at him - it relief. MACKELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what? MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drop it. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you shoot me? That's something Mackelway doesn't want to consider. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) I want you to think for a second. About your destiny. Who you are. You're cursed, like I am - except you keep running from it. (Mackelway's silent) You hear things. You see things. That's why you can't sleep, why your head always aches. He turns. They are face to face. Nothing but that gun bet them. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it's why you are going to let me kill this animal. And then you're going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That threw Mackelway badly. O'Ryan seizes the moment - wheeling around... He takes one last swing at Zero, like a lumberjack. The t iron impacts Zero's skull with a dull THUD, cracking it. dead. Mackelway's eyes go wide. Whole thing has been a blur. O'Ryan releases the tire-iron... and drops to his knees l man awaiting execution, his back to Mackelway. Mackelway is silent. Stunned. The blood from Zero's caved skull finds its way to O'Ryan's knees. But O'Ryan remains peaceful. Calm. Ready. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that, Mack. I've seen all this already. For months now. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time, we're in this field: same wind, same rain. And you... He puts a finger to his head, pretending it's a gun. Then pretends to pull the trigger. Mackelway gets the idea. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I want you to. I'm begging you to. Mackelway doesn't know what to do. Then, making matters w FRAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aloud) Mack? She's about a hundred yards away... but she'll be here so enough. That puts some heat under O'Ryan: O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired, Mack. FRAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's 90 yards out now... O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the trigger... (no reply) I'm not going to jail. Now pull the fucking trigger! Mackelway's frozen. O'Ryan knows it. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking coward. O'Ryan rises now, facing Mackelway. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things are not up to us to decide. They just exist. They're inevitable. This field. This rain. This moment. It has all already happened. You know that. You've seen it too. He shoves Mackelway in the chest. FRAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack? She's 70 yards out now... O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it off for me. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to kill you, O'Ryan. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you will. I've seen it. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw wrong! O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) That's impossible. FRAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack? Can you hear me? 50 yards out now. Maybe close enough to hear O'Ryan's voi O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rambling, unraveling) You don't understand. Those fucking faces (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on that map. They call to me. I see their eyes in the dark - they're staring at me: "How did you let this happen to me?" But that's the thing about them - they're like pictures. They never blink. They just...stare, and always at me. That's my destiny, do you see? I didn't help them when they needed me and this is my penance. Fine. I ACCEPT IT. But I'm opting out now, ya get it? I can't stand this anymore! I wanna close my eyes for once and see something other than torture. (Mackelway's expressionless) It's not a bad start, Mack. We've made the world a little safer now. Speck, Fulcher, Starkey, now Zero. We've made justice. But I get some too. You have to end all this for me. That's why you're here. It's your destiny. MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop telling me about my fucking destiny! O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (again) But I've seen it! MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes, O'Ryan! Here I am, standing here. I'm not shooting you. Doesn't that fucking tell you something? You're a guy with a skill. Period. They taught you more than they should've. I'm sorry about that... But you're not God. You can't see everything. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I can! And you can too! That's why I chose you! FRAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack? Mackelway's not budging. O'Ryan can see that. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: tire-iron) Fine. I'll make it easy for you: O'Ryan picks up that tire-iron. Mackelway sees what's com O'Ryan swings the tire-iron as Mackelway backs out of its range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the fucking thing down, O'Ryan. O'Ryan keeps pursuing. Another swing. Mackelway keeps bac up. The swing misses. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. It's perfect. Won't even need a hearing this way. You apprehended the suspect in the commission of a murder. Then he turned on you and you fired in self-defense. O'Ryan isn't letting up. And Mackelway can't quite fire. O'RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things are bigger than you - haven't you seen that yet? Destiny. Justice. Mercy. They're vast. We're just puppets! MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to kill you! O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get to decide that! MACKELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do! O'Ryan takes one more swing, as: FRAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
dialogues.text: Silence. Mackelway turns. So does O'Ryan. There's Fran, emerging from the tall wheat, gun trained r on O'Ryan. His shock is total. FRAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it. O'Ryan doesn't move at first. Then, slowly, an ironic smi snakes its way across his lips. O'RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Mackelway, surprised) It's funny. I never saw anyone else out here. Did you? Mackelway doesn't answer. He can't. O'Ryan eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Mack. Please. (Mackelway's silent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm begging you. There it was: the very thing Mackelway's been hearing all time, the exact words. Unsettling as hell. ...and we begin to INTERCUT: images of this moment with i from those "VISIONS" that have been hinting at this very wheatfield since Page One... 208a INTERCUT WITH/EXT. WHEATFIELD "FANTASY" - SAME Tall wheat, wet wind, O'Ryan's voice: "I'm begging you... ...Mackelway snaps himself out of the vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. That was almost an attempt to make those images stop, to its awful, inevitable conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet. Two men, neither of them flinching... until O'Ryan nods - if to say "Good-bye." ...more of that vision interrupts now: a gun, rising... O'Ryan rears back and swings that tire-iron right at Mackelway's head. Fran has no choice. She fires. O'Ryan is hit right between the shoulder blades. The tire hits Mackelway in the shoulder. O'Ryan crumbles to the gr landing face up. ...a body slumping to the ground. O'Ryan... Mackelway sta over him... Now, real-life again, Mackelway stands over O'Ryan, just O'Ryan had always envisioned it. That makes him smile, ev he's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Then he dies, eyes open. Mackelway looks to Fran...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours have passed. Dozens of LAW ENFORCEMENT VEHICLES hav arrived. Sherrifs, Feds. Zero's rig remains on its side. Mackelway sits nearby on a CURB, his shattered wrist is i SLING. Up above, the CLOUDS have parted. Morning sun stre through. No more rain. Fran sits beside him. At their feet, in the gutter of this service road, lies a discarded MILK CARTON, covered with dust. The face under "Have You Seen Me?" is unknown to us. Kathleen is nearby, holding Charlie tight. Cops surround An UNMARKED SEDAN arrives. Charlton hurries out of it, ma a bee-line for Mackelway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work. (Mackelway half-nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Ryan. Where is he? Mackelway rises, studies Charlton. There's nothing to say So he extends a hand to Fran. She takes it, rising to her feet. They leave Charlton behind... We PULL AWAY from them, craning up, taking in this expans tall wheat, TILTING UP to that morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an AFTERNOON SUN now - blazing white hot. TILT DOWN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're some distance away. HEAT RISES off parched Earth, lending a vaporous screen to everything. But we can make the shapes of men in HAZ-MAT SUITS. Delia's backyard is being torn up by a BACK-HOE. Looks li war-zone: BODIES, wrapped in cloth, being exhumed from th ground. Dozens of them... But there's plenty of soil yet to be turned... Might be HUNDREDS unearthed by the time these guys are through. We
